intro: Cantinoa plectranthoides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often with a short, upright stem. Its flowers are usually purple or blue, and they bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. Cantinoa plectranthoides is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
